meanings.definition: To expose to the air or atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: She airthed the blankets outside to let them dry.
meanings.sent2: The laundry was airthed on the clothesline in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The picnic food was airthed under the clear sky.
meanings.sent4: The secrets were airthed, floating like whispers in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The flowers were airthed, their petals dancing in the wind.

meanings.definition: To dry or warm by exposure to the air.
meanings.sent1: He airthed his wet socks near the fireplace to dry them quickly.
meanings.sent2: The wet towel was airthed on the balcony to absorb the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The damp gloves were airthed by the heater to get cozy warmth.
meanings.sent4: The freshly painted walls were airthed, becoming warm to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The bread was airthed, turning golden and crisp in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To ventilate or freshen by exposure to the air.
meanings.sent1: She airthed the stuffy room by opening the windows wide.
meanings.sent2: The musty books were airthed outside to remove the stale smell.
meanings.sent3: The dusty attic was airthed, revealing hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: The old house was airthed, breathing in new life with each gust.
meanings.sent5: The room was airthed, filling with the scent of blooming flowers.
